alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Northern Wayne; Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Susquehanna, north central Lackawanna and west central Wayne Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montrose, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Clifford, Forest City, Montrose, Dimock, Harford, New Milford, Vandling, Ararat and Hop Bottom. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 206 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
